description:
Role: Data Scientist – Mid
Location: Indianapolis, IN (100% Remote)
Type: Contract through EOY

Scope
The successful candidate will have a passion for building evaluation frameworks for answering business questions and discovering meaningful insights across various data states (e.g. observational data, model residuals, etc.), all while adopting team-wide best practices (e.g. clean code, reproducible/transferrable work, git, etc.) and maintaining effective levels of communication.

Responsibilities

\tJoin a collaborative team of data scientists with a focus on technical excellence, cross-team support, and high impact work.
\tSupport the development and delivery of data science capabilities that support evolving product capabilities.
\tDeliver clear, reproducible analysis while building or improving the teams core capabilities (such as reusable data pipelines, scripts, functions, documentation, etc.) along the way.
\tContribute to stand-ups, technical discussions, internal and external presentations, and team road mapping sessions.

Skills / Experience:

\tExperience independently answering business and related analytics questions with interpretable and direct quantitative approaches.
\tExperience in using Python for analysis, including the use of common libraries (pandas, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, seaborn, etc.), creating and sharing jupyter notebooks, and building reusable functions and scripts.
\tExperience leveraging various statistical tools to test hypotheses or generate distributions based on observational data to quantify uncertainty and confidence.
\tFluency in using SQL for common data access, transformations, and aggregations.
\tPh.D. or M.S. in Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Operations Research, or related scientific discipline.

Essential Skills

\tGrowth mindset with an interest in developing and maturing skills in statistics, coding, project management, and communication.
\tAbility to work in a matrixed, collaborative environment by using clear and direct asynchronous and synchronous communications.
\tIntellectual creativity to solve problems using new approaches and techniques.

Est. # of work hours per week: 40

Desired Start Date: 2-3 Weeks from Acceptance date

Estimated End Date: 12/31/24

EEO EmployerApex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.
